Page is not defined error on windows after integration with jest-puppeteer
1 upvote
Anakha · Lecture 50
· 3 years ago

Hi Kaniel,

        Thank you for this course, very easy to understand and interesting so far.

I am trying out the integration of jest with puppeteer and have done the steps mentioned:

1. npm install jest jest-puppeteer

2. initialised jest jest --init

2. set up the jest.config.js file with preset: "jest-puppeteer", also others mentioned in video.

3. set up the jest-puppeteer.config.js file with

module.exports={     launch:{         headless:false     },     browserContext:"default" };

4. Created a simple example.test.js file to just open the google page

describe('jest test',() => {

    it('Should launch browser',async function(){

       

        await page.goto("https://google.com/")

        await page.waitFor(5000)

    })

})

5. Upon executing npm run test, I am getting the below error: ReferenceError: page is not defined

Could you please help in resolving this error.



4 replies
JS
Jesús Adrián Acosta
0 upvotes
3 years ago

Hi friend, I think you need declare page like a var, some like that:  var page= await browser.newPage()

In my Script I use: 

    var browser = await puppeteer.launch({headless:true, slowMo:10, devtools:false})
    var  page= await browser.newPage()
     
    good luck

AN
Anakha
0 upvotes
3 years ago

Thank you for trying to help friend, but in the video Kaniel explains that jest-puppeteer handles setting up browser and page behind the scenes, so we do not have to explicitly declare page(explained in section 5 and lecture 100 as well) But I am still getting this error and think I have setup the config incorrectly, hence need help.
JS
Jesús Adrián Acosta
0 upvotes
3 years ago

oh, ok
JY
Jialie
0 upvotes
2 years ago

Do not forget to add preset:"jest-puppeteer", in jest.config.js
RS
